Because the organ transplant system is so complex, most people don‚Äôt know how it works, or if patients are being protected. That‚Äôs why I wrote an op-ed for @thehill today outlining why the system is broken and how we‚Äôre going to fix it. Read it here: https://thehill.com/blogs/congress-blog/healthcare/454457-reform-organ-donation-to-save-lives¬†‚Ä¶
This issue is personal for me. My friend and fellow Marine, Dave ‚ÄòGunny‚Äô McFarland from Jeffersonville, died because his heart transplant never came.
In Indiana, more than 1,300 Hoosiers are currently in need of an organ transplant. Nationally, more than 113,000 Americans are on the organ waitlist. These aren‚Äôt just statistics, these are lives.

Far too often I hear of students and their families being forced to endure financial hardship in exchange for a quality education. Government-provided student loan debt continues to skyrocket while the average household income decreases.

That‚Äôs why I just introduced the Government Bailout Prevention Act. These governments need to be on notice that they can‚Äôt continue down their fiscally risky path and expect federal taxpayers to pick up the check. https://www.young.senate.gov/newsroom/press-releases/young-toomey-cotton-introduce-bill-to-prevent-government-bailouts-protect-taxpayers¬†‚Ä¶
Some state and local governments continue to spend more money than they bring in and are racking up dangerous levels of debt. It‚Äôs unfair for Hoosiers to bail out this fiscal irresponsibility.
